alert.note: Alert for Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 18 at 1:34AM AKST until November 18 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Freezing rain and snow expected. Periods of low visibility in blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 3 PM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Driving and walking surfaces will become very slippery as ice forms on the ground. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could cause large snow drifts. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and freezing rain will continue into this early this afternoon, then change to all snow by late Friday afternoon. Low visibility in blowing snow is expected to continue into this afternoon. Snow will taper off Friday evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
